title: Wonder how many downvotes this will get.
body:
Lee sin is balanced. He can barley sustain in the jungle early levels and he falls off mega hard late game. He doesnt need a nerf.

Have fun downvoting


EDIT: This just in 1 downvote= 1 vote for bronze lee sin has a 47% winrate!

http://loldb.gameguyz.com/statistics/winRate

Dat jungle diversity though ... (note: image is based on win rates)
Winrate does not equal being balanced. LeBlanc had below 50% winrate and was nerfed because she had no counterplay with her silence.

If people are losing most thier games with a champion how does that make the champion viable for nerfs? Lol...

> [{quoted}](name=Ramen4Brunch,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=9E7WXAk8,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2015-01-06T15:30:33.222+0000)
>
> If people are losing most thier games with a champion how does that make the champion viable for nerfs? Lol...

Because people who actually know how to play him aren't?

In challenger tier (ALL challenger tiers) he's picked the most. As in, out of every single champion in the game Lee Sin is picked the most often. Also, in Challenger he has a 53.37% win rate.

Guess what, some champions suck in Bronze. Doesn't mean they aren't overpowered, just means they have a higher skillcap.

A tank should not be locked down by a kick that kicks him out of the mess.  (great crowd control)
Absorb shield functions as support, escape, mobility and gives a function of tankiness to an already great melee dps.
A champ that can function as assassin and Tank with a built in life steal.

There are somethings he could stand to lose.  But I feel the same thing about Wu.  No melee should be able to serve as tank and assassin by building DPS.

I totally agree with you
I play lee sin a lot and I can barley do golems red buff and blue without dieing
I think the problem here is you do not know how to play lee sin
